text: Karen M. Paget is an American political scientist, from Boulder, Colorado, United States. She is the author of non-fiction books. Her work appears at The American Prospect. ==Life== She holds a doctorate from the University of Colorado and a M.A. in International Affairs. She is the author of the book Patriotic Betrayal: The Inside Story of the CIA’s Secret Campaign to Enroll American Students in the Crusade Against Communism, launched in March 2015. After more than a decade of research, Karen Paget gathered archival sources, declassified documents, and interviews, showing that the National Student Association story published by Ramparts, was just part of a bigger CIA operation. == Works== * Patriotic Betrayal: The Inside Story of the CIA’s Secret Campaign to Enroll American Students in the Crusade Against Communism, New Haven: Yale University Press, 2015, , * Linda Witt; Karen M Paget; Glenna Matthews, Running as a Woman: Gender and Power The Free Press, 1993, , == References == == External links == *https://karenmpaget.com/ Category:American women writers Category:Writers from Boulder, Colorado Category:Living people Category:National Security Agency Category:Central Intelligence Agency Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
